snippet: Salah Hamidi says he must offer spiritual guidance to 600 inmates in a French prison while trying to detect signs among them of an influence of radical Islam.
abstract: Muslim chaplain Salah Hamidi says he feels pulled in two directions as he offers spiritual guidance to 600 Muslim inmates in French prison while helping prison officials determine which ones are attracted to idea of radicalization; in wake of terrorist attacks in Paris, government is relying on Muslim chaplains to prevent increase of radical Islam in prisons, where many terrorists are fomented.
lead_paragraph: Salah Hamidi says he must offer spiritual guidance to 600 inmates in a French prison while trying to detect signs among them of an influence of radical Islam.

headline.main: A Muslim Chaplain Caught in the Middle
headline.print_headline: A Muslim Chaplain Caught in the Middle
